 17 /**
 18  * Creates a new VR panorama in a canvas. <b>Requires WebGL or CSS3D support.</b>
 19  * (Note: See {@link bigshot.VRPanorama#dispose} for important information.)
 20  * 
 21  * <h3 id="creating-a-cubemap">Creating a Cube Map</h3>
 22  *
 23  * <p>The panorama consists of six image pyramids, one for each face of the VR cube.
 24  * Due to restrictions in WebGL, each texture tile must have a power-of-two (POT) size -
 25  * that is, 2, 4, ..., 128, 256, etc. Furthermore, due to the way the faces are tesselated
 26  * the largest image must consist of POT x POT tiles. The final restriction is that the 
 27  * tiles must overlap for good seamless results.
 28  *
 29  * <p>The MakeImagePyramid has some sensible defaults built-in. If you just use the
 30  * command line:
 31  *
 32  * <code><pre>
 33  * java -jar bigshot.jar input.jpg temp/dzi \
 34  *     --preset dzi-cubemap \ 
 35  *     --format folders
 36  * </pre></code>
 37  * 
 38  * <p>You will get 2034 pixels per face, and a tile size of 256 pixels with 2 pixels
 39  * overlap. If you don't like that, you can use the <code>overlap</code>, <code>face-size</code>
 40  * and <code>tile-size</code> parameters. Let's take these one by one:
 41  *
 42  * <ul>
 43  * <li><p><code>overlap</code>: Overlap defines how much tiles should overlap, just to avoid
 44  * seams in the rendered results caused by finite numeric precision. The default is <b>2</b>, which
 45  * I've found works great for me.</p></li>
 46  * <li><p><code>tile-size</code>: First you need to decide what POT size the output should be.
 47  * Then subtract the overlap value. For example, if you set overlap to 1, <code>tile-size</code>
 48  * could be 127, 255, 511, or any 2<sup>n</sup>-1 value.</p></li>
 49  * <li><p><code>face-size</code>: Finally, we decide on a size for the full cube face. This should be
 50  * tile-size * 2<sup>n</sup>. Let's say we set n=3, which makes each face 8x8 tiles at the most zoomed-in
 51  * level. For a tile-size of 255, then, face-size is 255*2<sup>3</sup> = 255*8 = <b>2040</b>.</p></li>
 52  * </ul>
 53  * 
 54  * <p>A command line for the hypothetical scenario above would be:
 55  * 
 56  * <code><pre>
 57  * java -jar bigshot.jar input.jpg temp/dzi \
 58  *     --preset dzi-cubemap \ 
 59  *     --overlap 1 \
 60  *     --tile-size 255 \
 61  *     --face-size 2040 \
 62  *     --format folders
 63  * </pre></code>
 64  *
 65  * <p>If your tile size numbers don't add up, you'll get a warning like:
 66  *
 67  * <code><pre>
 68  * WARNING: Resulting image tile size (tile-size + overlap) is not a power of two: 255
 69  * </pre></code>
 70  *
 71  * <p>If your face size don't add up, you'll get another warning:
 72  *
 73  * <code><pre>
 74  * WARNING: face-size is not an even multiple of tile-size: 2040 % 254 != 0
 75  * </pre></code>
 76  *
 77  * <h3 id="integration-with-saladoplayer">Integration With SaladoPlayer</h3>
 78  *
 79  * <p><a href="http://panozona.com/wiki/">SaladoPlayer</a> is a cool
 80  * Flash-based VR panorama viewer that can display Deep Zoom Images.
 81  * It can be used as a fallback for Bigshot for browsers that don't
 82  * support WebGL.
 83  *
 84  * <p>Since Bigshot can use a Deep Zoom Image (DZI) via a {@link bigshot.DeepZoomImageFileSystem}
 85  * adapter, the common file format is DZI. There are two cases: The first is
 86  * when the DZI is served up as a folder structure, the second when
 87  * we pack the DZI into a Bigshot archive and serve it using bigshot.php.
 88  *
 89  * <h4>Serving DZI as Folders</h4>
 90  *
 91  * <p>This is an easy one. First, we generate the required DZIs:
 92  *
 93  * <code><pre>
 94  * java -jar bigshot.jar input.jpg temp/dzi \
 95  *     --preset dzi-cubemap \ 
 96  *     --format folders
 97  * </pre></code>
 98  * 
 99  * <p>We'll assume that we have the six DZI folders in "temp/dzi", and that
100  * they have "face_" as a common prefix (which is what Bigshot's MakeImagePyramid
101  * outputs). So we have, for example, "temp/dzi/face_f.xml" and the tiles for face_f
102  * in "temp/dzi/face_f/". Set up Bigshot like this:
103  *
104  * <code><pre>
105  * bvr = new bigshot.VRPanorama (
106  *     new bigshot.VRPanoramaParameters ({
107  *             container : document.getElementById ("canvas"),
108  *             basePath : "temp/dzi",
109  *             fileSystemType : "dzi"
110  *         }));
111  * </pre></code>
112  * 
113  * <p>SaladoPlayer uses an XML config file, which in this case will
114  * look something like this:
115  * 
116  * <code><pre>
117  * <SaladoPlayer>
118  *     <global debug="false" firstPanorama="pano"/>
119  *     <panoramas>
120  *         <panorama id="pano" path="temp/dzi/face_f.xml"/>
121  *     </panoramas>
122  * </SaladoPlayer>
123  * </pre></code>
124  *
125  * <h4>Serving DZI as Archive</h4>
126  *
127  * <p>This one is a bit more difficult. First we create a DZI as a bigshot archive:
128  *
129  * <code><pre>
130  * java -jar bigshot.jar input.jpg temp/dzi.bigshot \
131  *     --preset dzi-cubemap \ 
132  *     --format archive
133  * </pre></code>
134  *
135  * <p>We'll assume that we have our Bigshot archive at
136  * "temp/dzi.bigshot". For this we will use the "entry" parameter of bigshot.php
137  * to serve up the right files:
138  *
139  * <code><pre>
140  * bvr = new bigshot.VRPanorama (
141  *     new bigshot.VRPanoramaParameters ({
142  *             container : document.getElementById ("canvas"),
143  *             basePath : "/bigshot.php?file=temp/dzi.bigshot&entry=",
144  *             fileSystemType : "dzi"
145  *         }));
146  * </pre></code>
147  * 
148  * <p>SaladoPlayer uses an XML config file, which in this case will
149  * look something like this:
150  * 
151  * <code><pre>
152  * <SaladoPlayer>
153  *     <global debug="false" firstPanorama="pano"/>
154  *     <panoramas>
155  *         <panorama id="pano" path="/bigshot.php?file=dzi.bigshot&amp;entry=face_f.xml"/>
156  *     </panoramas>
157  * </SaladoPlayer>
158  * </pre></code>
159  *
160  * <h3>Usage example:</h3>
161  * @example
162  * var bvr = new bigshot.VRPanorama (
163  *     new bigshot.VRPanoramaParameters ({
164  *             basePath : "/bigshot.php?file=myvr.bigshot",
165  *             fileSystemType : "archive",
166  *             container : document.getElementById ("bigshot_canvas")
167  *         }));
168  * @class A cube-map VR panorama.
169  * @extends bigshot.EventDispatcher
170  *
171  * @param {bigshot.VRPanoramaParameters} parameters the panorama parameters.
172  *
173  * @see bigshot.VRPanoramaParameters
174  */
175 bigshot.VRPanorama = function (parameters) {
176     bigshot.EventDispatcher.call (this);
177     
178     var that = this;
179     
180     this.parameters = parameters;
181     this.maxTextureMagnification = parameters.maxTextureMagnification;
182     this.container = parameters.container;
183     this.browser = new bigshot.Browser ();
184     this.dragStart = null;
185     this.dragDistance = 0;
186     this.hotspots = [];
187     this.disposed = false;
188     
189     this.transformOffsets = {
190         y : parameters.yawOffset,
191         p : parameters.pitchOffset,
192         r : parameters.rollOffset
193     };
194     
195     /**
196      * Current camera state.
197      * @private
198      */
199     this.state = {
200         rotation : {
201             /**
202              * Pitch in degrees.
203              * @type float
204              * @private
205              */
206             p : 0.0,
207             
208             /**
209              * Yaw in degrees.
210              * @type float
211              * @private
212              */
213             y : 0.0,
214             
215             r : 0
216         },
217         
218         /**
219          * Field of view (vertical) in degrees.
220          * @type float
221          * @private
222          */
223         fov : 45,
224         
225         translation : {
226             /**
227              * Translation along X-axis.
228              * @private
229              * @type float
230              */
231             x : 0.0,
232             
233             /**
234              * Translation along Y-axis.
235              * @private
236              * @type float
237              */
238             y : 0.0,
239             
240             /**
241              * Translation along Z-axis.
242              * @private
243              * @type float
244              */
245             z : 0.0
246         }
247     };
248     
249     /**
250      * Renderer wrapper.
251      * @private
252      * @type bigshot.VRRenderer
253      */
254     this.renderer = null;
255     if (this.parameters.renderer) {
256         if (this.parameters.renderer == "css") {
257             this.renderer = new bigshot.CSS3DVRRenderer (this.container);
258         } else if (this.parameters.renderer == "webgl") {
259             this.renderer = new bigshot.WebGLVRRenderer (this.container)
260         } else {
261             throw new Error ("Unknown renderer: " + this.parameters.renderer);
262         }
263     } else {
264         this.renderer = 
265             bigshot.WebGLUtil.isWebGLSupported () ? 
266         new bigshot.WebGLVRRenderer (this.container)
267         :
268         new bigshot.CSS3DVRRenderer (this.container);
269     }
270     
271     /**
272      * List of render listeners to call at the start and end of each render.
273      *
274      * @private
275      */
276     this.renderListeners = new Array (); 
277     
278     this.renderables = new Array ();
279     
280     /**
281      * Current value of the idle counter.
282      *
283      * @private
284      */
285     this.idleCounter = 0;
286     
287     /**
288      * Maximum value of the idle counter before any idle events start,
289      * such as autorotation.
290      *
291      * @private
292      */
293     this.maxIdleCounter = -1;
294     
295     
296     /**
297      * Integer acting as a "permit". When the smoothRotate function
298      * is called, the current value is incremented and saved. If the number changes
299      * that particular call to smoothRotate stops. This way we avoid
300      * having multiple smoothRotate rotations going in parallel.
301      * @private
302      * @type int
303      */
304     this.smoothrotatePermit = 0;
305     
306     /**
307      * Helper function to consume events.
308      * @private
309      */
310     var consumeEvent = function (event) {
311         if (event.preventDefault) {
312             event.preventDefault ();
313         }
314         return false;
315     };
316     
317     /**
318      * Full screen handler.
319      *
320      * @private
321      */
322     this.fullScreenHandler = null;
323     
324     this.renderAsapPermitTaken = false;
325     
326     /**
327      * An element to use as reference when resizing the canvas element.
328      * If non-null, any onresize() calls will result in the canvas being
329      * resized to the size of this element.
330      *
331      * @private
332      */
333     this.sizeContainer = null;
334     
335     /**
336      * The six cube faces.
337      *
338      * @type bigshot.VRFace[]
339      * @private
340      */
341     var facesInit = {
342         facesLeft : 6,
343         faceLoaded : function () {
344             this.facesLeft--;
345             if (this.facesLeft == 0) {
346                 if (that.parameters.onload) {
347                     that.parameters.onload ();
348                 }
349             }
350         }
351     };
352     var onFaceLoad = function () { 
353         facesInit.faceLoaded () 
354     };
355     
356     this.vrFaces = new Array ();
357     this.vrFaces[0] = new bigshot.VRFace (this, "f", {x:-1, y:1, z:-1}, 2.0, {x:1, y:0, z:0}, {x:0, y:-1, z:0}, onFaceLoad);
358     this.vrFaces[1] = new bigshot.VRFace (this, "b", {x:1, y:1, z:1}, 2.0, {x:-1, y:0, z:0}, {x:0, y:-1, z:0}, onFaceLoad);
359     this.vrFaces[2] = new bigshot.VRFace (this, "l", {x:-1, y:1, z:1}, 2.0, {x:0, y:0, z:-1}, {x:0, y:-1, z:0}, onFaceLoad);
360     this.vrFaces[3] = new bigshot.VRFace (this, "r", {x:1, y:1, z:-1}, 2.0, {x:0, y:0, z:1}, {x:0, y:-1, z:0}, onFaceLoad);
361     this.vrFaces[4] = new bigshot.VRFace (this, "u", {x:-1, y:1, z:1}, 2.0, {x:1, y:0, z:0}, {x:0, y:0, z:-1}, onFaceLoad);
362     this.vrFaces[5] = new bigshot.VRFace (this, "d", {x:-1, y:-1, z:-1}, 2.0, {x:1, y:0, z:0}, {x:0, y:0, z:1}, onFaceLoad);
363     
364     /**
365      * Helper function to translate touch events to mouse-like events.
366      * @private
367      */
368     var translateEvent = function (event) {
369         if (event.clientX) {
370             return event;
371         } else {
372             return {
373                 clientX : event.changedTouches[0].clientX,
374                 clientY : event.changedTouches[0].clientY
375             };
376         };
377     };
378     
379     this.lastTouchStartAt = -1;
380     
381     this.allListeners = {
382         "mousedown" : function (e) {
383             that.smoothRotate ();
384             that.resetIdle ();            
385             that.dragMouseDown (e);
386             return consumeEvent (e);
387         },
388         "mouseup" : function (e) {
389             that.resetIdle ();
390             that.dragMouseUp (e);
391             return consumeEvent (e);
392         },
393         "mousemove" : function (e) {
394             that.resetIdle ();
395             that.dragMouseMove (e);
396             return consumeEvent (e);
397         },
398         "gesturestart" : function (e) {
399             that.gestureStart (e);
400             return consumeEvent (e);
401         },
402         "gesturechange" : function (e) {
403             that.gestureChange (e);
404             return consumeEvent (e);
405         },
406         "gestureend" : function (e) {
407             that.gestureEnd (e);
408             return consumeEvent (e);
409         },
410         
411         "DOMMouseScroll" : function (e) {
412             that.resetIdle ();
413             that.mouseWheel (e);
414             return consumeEvent (e);
415         },
416         "mousewheel" : function (e) {
417             that.resetIdle ();
418             that.mouseWheel (e);
419             return consumeEvent (e);
420         },
421         "dblclick" : function (e) {
422             that.mouseDoubleClick (e);
423             return consumeEvent (e);
424         },
425         
426         "touchstart" : function (e) {
427             that.smoothRotate ();
428             that.lastTouchStartAt = new Date ().getTime ();
429             that.resetIdle ();
430             that.dragMouseDown (translateEvent (e));
431             return consumeEvent (e);
432         },
433         "touchend" : function (e) {
434             that.resetIdle ();
435             var handled = that.dragMouseUp (translateEvent (e));
436             if (!handled && (that.lastTouchStartAt > new Date().getTime() - 350)) {
437                 that.mouseDoubleClick (translateEvent (e));
438             }
439             that.lastTouchStartAt = -1;
440             return consumeEvent (e);
441         },
442         "touchmove" : function (e) {
443             if (that.dragDistance > 24) {                
444                 that.lastTouchStartAt = -1;
445             }
446             that.resetIdle ();
447             that.dragMouseMove (translateEvent (e));
448             return consumeEvent (e);
449         }
450     };
451     this.addEventListeners ();
452     
453     /**
454      * Stub function to call onresize on this instance.
455      *
456      * @private
457      */
458     this.onresizeHandler = function (e) {
459         that.onresize ();
460     };
461     
462     this.browser.registerListener (window, 'resize', this.onresizeHandler, false);
463     this.browser.registerListener (document.body, 'orientationchange', this.onresizeHandler, false);
464     
465     this.setPitch (0.0);
466     this.setYaw (0.0);
467     this.setFov (45.0);
468 }
469 
470 /*
471  * Statics
472  */
473 
474 /**
475  * When the mouse is pressed and dragged, the camera rotates
476  * proportionally to the length of the dragging.
477  *
478  * @constant
479  * @public
480  * @static
481  */
482 bigshot.VRPanorama.DRAG_GRAB = "grab";
483 
484 /**
485  * When the mouse is pressed and dragged, the camera continuously
486  * rotates with a speed that is proportional to the length of the 
487  * dragging.
488  *
489  * @constant
490  * @public
491  * @static
492  */
493 bigshot.VRPanorama.DRAG_PAN = "pan";
494 
495 /**
496  * @name bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderState
497  * @class The state the renderer is in when a {@link bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderListener} is called.
498  *
499  * @see bigshot.VRPanorama.ONRENDER_BEGIN
500  * @see bigshot.VRPanorama.ONRENDER_END
501  */
502 
503 /**
504  * A RenderListener state parameter value used at the start of each render.
505  * 
506  * @constant
507  * @public
508  * @static
509  * @type bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderState
510  */
511 bigshot.VRPanorama.ONRENDER_BEGIN = 0;
512 
513 /**
514  * A RenderListener state parameter value used at the end of each render.
515  * 
516  * @constant
517  * @public
518  * @static
519  * @type bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderState
520  */
521 bigshot.VRPanorama.ONRENDER_END = 1;
522 
523 /**
524  * A RenderListener cause parameter indicating that a previously requested 
525  * texture has loaded and a render is forced. The data parameter is not used.
526  *
527  * @constant
528  * @public
529  * @static
530  * @param {bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderCause}
531  */
532 bigshot.VRPanorama.ONRENDER_TEXTURE_UPDATE = 0;
533 
534 /**
535  * @name bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderCause
536  * @class The reason why the {@link bigshot.VRPanorama} is being rendered.
537  * Due to the events outside of the panorama, the VR panorama may be forced to
538  * re-render itself. When this happens, the {@link bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderListener}s
539  * receive a constant indicating the cause of the rendering.
540  * 
541  * @see bigshot.VRPanorama.ONRENDER_TEXTURE_UPDATE
542  */
543 
544 /**
545  * Specification for functions passed to {@link bigshot.VRPanorama#addRenderListener}.
546  *
547  * @name bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderListener
548  * @function
549  * @param {bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderState} state The state of the renderer. Can be {@link bigshot.VRPanorama.ONRENDER_BEGIN} or {@link bigshot.VRPanorama.ONRENDER_END}
550  * @param {bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderCause} [cause] The reason for rendering the scene. Can be undefined or {@link bigshot.VRPanorama.ONRENDER_TEXTURE_UPDATE}
551  * @param {Object} [data] An optional data object that is dependent on the cause. See the documentation 
552  *             for the different causes.
553  */
554 
555 /**
556  * Specification for functions passed to {@link bigshot.VRPanorama#addRenderable}.
557  *
558  * @name bigshot.VRPanorama.Renderable
559  * @function
560  * @param {bigshot.VRRenderer} renderer The renderer object to use.
561  * @param {bigshot.TexturedQuadScene} scene The scene to render into.
562  */
563 
564 /** */
565 bigshot.VRPanorama.prototype = {
566     /**
567      * Adds a hotstpot.
568      *
569      * @param {bigshot.VRHotspot} hs the hotspot to add
570      */
571     addHotspot : function (hs) {
572         this.hotspots.push (hs);
573     },
574     
575     /**
576      * Returns the {@link bigshot.VRPanoramaParameters} object used by this instance.
577      *
578      * @type bigshot.VRPanoramaParameters
579      */
580     getParameters : function () {
581         return this.parameters;
582     },
583     
584     /**
585      * Sets the view translation.
586      *
587      * @param x translation of the viewer along the X axis
588      * @param y translation of the viewer along the Y axis
589      * @param z translation of the viewer along the Z axis
590      */
591     setTranslation : function (x, y, z) {
592         this.state.translation.x = x;
593         this.state.translation.y = y;
594         this.state.translation.z = z;
595     },
596     
597     /**
598      * Returns the current view translation as an x-y-z triplet.
599      *
600      * @returns {number} x translation of the viewer along the X axis
601      * @returns {number} y translation of the viewer along the Y axis
602      * @returns {number} z translation of the viewer along the Z axis
603      */
604     getTranslation : function () {
605         return this.state.translation;
606     },
607     
608     /**
609      * Sets the field of view.
610      *
611      * @param {number} fov the vertical field of view, in degrees
612      */
613     setFov : function (fov) {
614         fov = Math.min (this.parameters.maxFov, fov);
615         fov = Math.max (this.parameters.minFov, fov);
616         this.state.fov = fov;
617     },
618     
619     /**
620      * Gets the field of view.
621      *
622      * @return {number} the vertical field of view, in degrees
623      */
624     getFov : function () {
625         return this.state.fov;
626     },
627     
628     /**
629      * Returns the angle (yaw, pitch) for a given pixel coordinate.
630      *
631      * @param {number} x the x-coordinate of the pixel, measured in pixels 
632      *                 from the left edge of the panorama.
633      * @param {number} y the y-coordinate of the pixel, measured in pixels 
634      *                 from the top edge of the panorama.
635      * @return {number} .yaw the yaw angle of the pixel (0 <= yaw < 360)
636      * @return {number} .pitch the pitch angle of the pixel (-180 <= pitch <= 180)
637      *
638      * @example
639      * var container = ...; // an HTML element
640      * var pano = ...; // a bigshot.VRPanorama
641      * ...
642      * container.addEventListener ("click", function (e) {
643      *     var clickX = e.clientX - container.offsetX;
644      *     var clickY = e.clientY - container.offsetY;
645      *     var polar = pano.screenToPolar (clickX, clickY);
646      *     alert ("You clicked at: " + 
647      *            "Yaw: " + polar.yaw + 
648      *            "  Pitch: " + polar.pitch);
649      * });
650      */
651     screenToPolar : function (x, y) {
652         var dray = this.screenToRayDelta (x, y);
653         var ray = $V([dray.x, dray.y, dray.z, 1.0]);
654         
655         ray = Matrix.RotationX (this.getPitch () * Math.PI / 180.0).ensure4x4 ().x (ray);
656         ray = Matrix.RotationY (-this.getYaw () * Math.PI / 180.0).ensure4x4 ().x (ray);
657         
658         var dx = ray.e(1);
659         var dy = ray.e(2);
660         var dz = ray.e(3);
661         
662         var dxz = Math.sqrt (dx * dx + dz * dz);
663         
664         var dyaw = Math.atan2 (dx, -dz) * 180 / Math.PI;
665         var dpitch = Math.atan2 (dy, dxz) * 180 / Math.PI;
666         
667         var res = {};
668         res.yaw = (dyaw + 360) % 360.0;
669         res.pitch = dpitch;
670         
671         return res;
672     },
673     
674     /**
675      * Restricts the pitch value to be between the minPitch and maxPitch parameters.
676      * 
677      * @param {number} p the pitch value
678      * @returns the constrained pitch value.
679      */
680     snapPitch : function (p) {
681         p = Math.min (this.parameters.maxPitch, p);
682         p = Math.max (this.parameters.minPitch, p);
683         return p;
684     },
685     
686     /**
687      * Sets the current camera pitch.
688      *
689      * @param {number} p the pitch, in degrees
690      */
691     setPitch : function (p) {
692         this.state.rotation.p = this.snapPitch (p);
693     },
694     
695     /**
696      * Subtraction mod 360, sort of...
697      *
698      * @private
699      * @returns the angular distance with smallest magnitude to add to p0 to get to p1 % 360
700      */
701     circleDistance : function (p0, p1) {
702         if (p1 > p0) {
703             // p1 is somewhere clockwise to p0
704             var d1 = (p1 - p0); // move clockwise
705             var d2 = ((p1 - 360) - p0); // move counterclockwise, first -p0 to get to 0, then p1 - 360.
706             return Math.abs (d1) < Math.abs (d2) ? d1 : d2;
707         } else {
708             // p1 is somewhere counterclockwise to p0
709             var d1 = (p1 - p0); // move counterclockwise
710             var d2 = (360 - p0) + p1; // move clockwise, first (360-p= to get to 0, then another p1 degrees
711             return Math.abs (d1) < Math.abs (d2) ? d1 : d2;
712         }
713     },
714     
715     /**
716      * Subtraction mod 360, sort of...
717      *
718      * @private
719      */
720     circleSnapTo : function (p, p1, p2) {
721         var d1 = this.circleDistance (p, p1);
722         var d2 = this.circleDistance (p, p2);
723         return Math.abs (d1) < Math.abs (d2) ? p1 : p2;
724     },
725     
726     /**
727      * Constrains a yaw value to the required minimum and maximum values.
728      *
729      * @private
730      */
731     snapYaw : function (y) {
732         y %= 360;
733         if (y < 0) {
734             y += 360;
735         }
736         if (this.parameters.minYaw < this.parameters.maxYaw) {
737             if (y > this.parameters.maxYaw || y < this.parameters.minYaw) {
738                 y = circleSnapTo (y, this.parameters.minYaw, this.parameters.maxYaw);
739             }
740         } else {
741             // The only time when minYaw > maxYaw is when the interval
742             // contains the 0 angle.
743             if (y > this.parameters.minYaw) {
744                 // ok, we're somewhere between minYaw and 0.0
745             } else if (y > this.parameters.maxYaw) {
746                 // we're somewhere between maxYaw and minYaw 
747                 // (but on the wrong side).
748                 // figure out the nearest point and snap to it
749                 y = circleSnapTo (y, this.parameters.minYaw, this.parameters.maxYaw);
750             } else {
751                 // ok, we're somewhere between 0.0 and maxYaw
752             }
753         }
754         return y;
755     },
756     
757     /**
758      * Sets the current camera yaw. The yaw is normalized between
759      * 0 <= y < 360.
760      *
761      * @param {number} y the yaw, in degrees
762      */
763     setYaw : function (y) {
764         this.state.rotation.y = this.snapYaw (y);
765     },
766     
767     /**
768      * Gets the current camera yaw.
769      *
770      * @return {number} the yaw, in degrees
771      */
772     getYaw : function () {
773         return this.state.rotation.y;
774     },
775     
776     /**
777      * Gets the current camera pitch.
778      *
779      * @return {number} the pitch, in degrees
780      */
781     getPitch : function () {
782         return this.state.rotation.p;
783     },
784     
785     /**
786      * Unregisters event handlers and other page-level hooks. The client need not call this
787      * method unless bigshot images are created and removed from the page
788      * dynamically. In that case, this method must be called when the client wishes to
789      * free the resources allocated by the image. Otherwise the browser will garbage-collect
790      * all resources automatically.
791      * @public
792      */
793     dispose : function () {
794         this.disposed = true;
795         this.browser.unregisterListener (window, "resize", this.onresizeHandler, false);
796         this.browser.unregisterListener (document.body, "orientationchange", this.onresizeHandler, false);
797         this.removeEventListeners ();
798         
799         for (var i = 0; i < this.vrFaces.length; ++i) {
800             this.vrFaces[i].dispose ();
801         }
802         this.renderer.dispose ();
803     },
804     
805     /**
806      * Creates and initializes a {@link bigshot.VREvent} object.
807      * The {@link bigshot.VREvent#ray}, {@link bigshot.VREvent#yaw},
808      * {@link bigshot.VREvent#pitch}, {@link bigshot.Event#target} and
809      * {@link bigshot.Event#currentTarget} fields are set.
810      * 
811      * @param {Object} data the data object for the event
812      * @param {number} data.clientX the client x-coordinate of the event
813      * @param {number} data.clientY the client y-coordinate of the event
814      * @returns the new event object
815      * @type bigshot.VREvent
816      */
817     createVREventData : function (data) {
818         var elementPos = this.browser.getElementPosition (this.container);
819         data.localX = data.clientX - elementPos.x;
820         data.localY = data.clientY - elementPos.y;
821         
822         data.ray = this.screenToRay (data.localX, data.localY);
823         
824         var polar = this.screenToPolar (data.localX, data.localY);
825         data.yaw = polar.yaw;
826         data.pitch = polar.pitch;
827         data.target = this;
828         data.currentTarget = this;
829         
830         return new bigshot.VREvent (data);
831     },
832     
833     
834     /**
835      * Sets up transformation matrices etc. Calls all render listeners with a state parameter
836      * of {@link bigshot.VRPanorama.ONRENDER_BEGIN}.
837      *
838      * @private
839      *
840      * @param [cause] parameter for the {@link bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderListener}s.
841      * @param [data] parameter for the {@link bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderListener}s.
842      */
843     beginRender : function (cause, data) {
844         this.onrender (bigshot.VRPanorama.ONRENDER_BEGIN, cause, data);
845         this.renderer.beginRender (this.state.rotation, this.state.fov, this.state.translation, this.transformOffsets);
846     },
847     
848     
849     /**
850      * Add a function that will be called at various times during the render.
851      *
852      * @param {bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderListener} listener the listener function
853      */
854     addRenderListener : function (listener) {
855         var rl = new Array ();
856         rl = rl.concat (this.renderListeners);
857         rl.push (listener);
858         this.renderListeners = rl;
859     },
860     
861     /**
862      * Removes a function that will be called at various times during the render.
863      *
864      * @param {bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderListener} listener the listener function
865      */
866     removeRenderListener : function (listener) {
867         var rl = new Array ();
868         rl = rl.concat (this.renderListeners);
869         for (var i = 0; i < rl.length; ++i) {
870             if (rl[i] === listener) {
871                 rl.splice (i, 1);
872                 break;
873             }
874         }
875         this.renderListeners = rl;
876     },
877     
878     /**
879      * Called at the start and end of every render.
880      *
881      * @event
882      * @private
883      * @type function()
884      * @param {bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderState} state the current render state
885      */
886     onrender : function (state, cause, data) {
887         var rl = this.renderListeners;
888         for (var i = 0; i < rl.length; ++i) {
889             rl[i](state, cause, data);
890         }
891     },
892     
893     /**
894      * Performs per-render cleanup. Calls all render listeners with a state parameter
895      * of {@link bigshot.VRPanorama.ONRENDER_END}.
896      *
897      * @private
898      * 
899      * @param [cause] parameter for the {@link bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderListener}s.
900      * @param [data] parameter for the {@link bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderListener}s.
901      */
902     endRender : function (cause, data) {
903         for (var f in this.vrFaces) {
904             this.vrFaces[f].endRender ();
905         }
906         this.renderer.endRender ();
907         this.onrender (bigshot.VRPanorama.ONRENDER_END, cause, data);
908     },
909     
910     /**
911      * Add a function that will be called to render any additional quads.
912      *
913      * @param {bigshot.VRPanorama.Renderable} renderable The renderable, a function responsible for
914      * rendering additional scene elements.
915      */
916     addRenderable : function (renderable) {
917         var rl = new Array ();
918         rl.concat (this.renderables);
919         rl.push (renderable);
920         this.renderables = rl;
921     },
922     
923     /**
924      * Removes a function that will be called to render any additional quads.
925      *
926      * @param {bigshot.VRPanorama.Renderable} renderable The renderable added using
927      * {@link bigshot.VRPanorama#addRenderable}.
928      */
929     removeRenderable : function (renderable) {
930         var rl = new Array ();
931         rl.concat (this.renderables);
932         for (var i = 0; i < rl.length; ++i) {
933             if (rl[i] == listener) {
934                 rl.splice (i, 1);
935                 break;
936             }
937         }
938         this.renderables = rl;
939     },
940     
941     /**
942      * Renders the VR cube.
943      *
944      * @param [cause] parameter for the {@link bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderListener}s.
945      * @param [data] parameter for the {@link bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderListener}s.
946      */
947     render : function (cause, data) {
948         if (!this.disposed) {
949             this.beginRender (cause, data);
950             
951             var scene = this.renderer.createTexturedQuadScene ();
952             
953             for (var f in this.vrFaces) {
954                 this.vrFaces[f].render (scene);
955             }
956             
957             for (var i = 0; i < this.renderables.length; ++i) {
958                 this.renderables[i](this.renderer, scene);
959             }
960             
961             scene.render ();
962             
963             for (var i = 0; i < this.hotspots.length; ++i) {
964                 this.hotspots[i].layout ();
965             }
966             
967             this.endRender (cause, data);
968         }
969     },
970     
971     /**
972      * Render updated faces. Called as tiles are loaded from the server.
973      *
974      * @param [cause] parameter for the {@link bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderListener}s.
975      * @param [data] parameter for the {@link bigshot.VRPanorama.RenderListener}s.
976      */
977     renderUpdated : function (cause, data) {
978         if (!this.disposed && this.renderer.supportsUpdate ()) {
979             this.beginRender (cause, data);
980             
981             var scene = this.renderer.createTexturedQuadScene ();
982             
983             for (var f in this.vrFaces) {
984                 if (this.vrFaces[f].isUpdated ()) {
985                     this.vrFaces[f].render (scene);
986                 }
987             }
988             
989             scene.render ();
990             
991             for (var i = 0; i < this.hotspots.length; ++i) {
992                 this.hotspots[i].layout ();
993             }
994             
995             this.endRender (cause, data);
996         } else {
997             this.render (cause, data);
998         }
999     },
1000     
1001     /**
1002      * The current drag mode.
1003      * 
1004      * @private
1005      */
1006     dragMode : bigshot.VRPanorama.DRAG_GRAB,
1007     
1008     /**
1009      * Sets the mouse dragging mode.
1010      *
1011      * @param mode one of {@link bigshot.VRPanorama.DRAG_PAN} or {@link bigshot.VRPanorama.DRAG_GRAB}.
1012      */
1013     setDragMode : function (mode) {
1014         this.dragMode = mode;
1015     },
1016     
1017     addEventListeners : function () {
1018         for (var k in this.allListeners) {
1019             this.browser.registerListener (this.container, k, this.allListeners[k], false);
1020         }
1021     },
1022     
1023     removeEventListeners : function () {
1024         for (var k in this.allListeners) {
1025             this.browser.unregisterListener (this.container, k, this.allListeners[k], false);
1026         }
1027     },
1028     
1029     dragMouseDown : function (e) {
1030         this.dragStart = {
1031             clientX : e.clientX,
1032             clientY : e.clientY
1033         };
1034         this.dragLast = {
1035             clientX : e.clientX,
1036             clientY : e.clientY,
1037             dx : 0,
1038             dy : 0,
1039             dt : 1000000,
1040             time : new Date ().getTime ()
1041         };
1042         this.dragDistance = 0;
1043     },
1044     
1045     dragMouseUp : function (e) {
1046         // In case we got a mouse up with out a previous mouse down,
1047         // for example, double-click on title bar to maximize the 
1048         // window
1049         if (this.dragStart == null || this.dragLast == null) {
1050             this.dragStart = null;
1051             this.dragLast = null;
1052             return;
1053         }
1054         
1055         this.dragStart = null;
1056         var dx = this.dragLast.dx;
1057         var dy = this.dragLast.dy;
1058         var ds = Math.sqrt (dx * dx + dy * dy);
1059         var dt = this.dragLast.dt;
1060         var dtb = new Date ().getTime () - this.dragLast.time;
1061         this.dragLast = null;
1062         
1063         var v = dt > 0 ? (ds / dt) : 0;
1064         if (v > 0.05 && dtb < 250 && dt > 20 && this.parameters.fling) {
1065             var scale = this.state.fov / this.renderer.getViewportHeight ();
1066             
1067             var t0 = new Date ().getTime ();
1068             
1069             var flingScale = this.parameters.flingScale;
1070             
1071             dx /= dt;
1072             dy /= dt;
1073             
1074             this.smoothRotate (function (dat) {
1075                     var dt = new Date ().getTime () - t0;
1076                     var fact = Math.pow (2, -dt * flingScale);
1077                     var d = (dx * dat * scale) * fact;
1078                     return fact > 0.01 ? d : null;
1079                 }, function (dat) {
1080                     var dt = new Date ().getTime () - t0;
1081                     var fact = Math.pow (2, -dt * flingScale);
1082                     var d = (dy * dat * scale) * fact;
1083                     return fact > 0.01 ? d : null;
1084                 }, function () {
1085                     return null;
1086                 });
1087             return true;
1088         } else {
1089             this.smoothRotate ();
1090             return false;
1091         }
1092     },
1093     
1094     dragMouseMove : function (e) {
1095         if (this.dragStart != null && this.currentGesture == null) {
1096             if (this.dragMode == bigshot.VRPanorama.DRAG_GRAB) {
1097                 this.smoothRotate ();
1098                 var scale = this.state.fov / this.renderer.getViewportHeight ();
1099                 var dx = e.clientX - this.dragStart.clientX;
1100                 var dy = e.clientY - this.dragStart.clientY;
1101                 this.dragDistance += dx + dy;
1102                 this.setYaw (this.getYaw () - dx * scale);
1103                 this.setPitch (this.getPitch () - dy * scale);
1104                 this.renderAsap ();
1105                 this.dragStart = e;
1106                 var dt = new Date ().getTime () - this.dragLast.time;
1107                 if (dt > 20) {
1108                     this.dragLast = {
1109                         dx : this.dragLast.clientX - e.clientX,
1110                         dy : this.dragLast.clientY - e.clientY,
1111                         dt : dt,
1112                         clientX : e.clientX,
1113                         clientY : e.clientY,
1114                         time : new Date ().getTime ()
1115                     };
1116                 }
1117             } else {
1118                 var scale = 0.1 * this.state.fov / this.renderer.getViewportHeight ();
1119                 var dx = e.clientX - this.dragStart.clientX;
1120                 var dy = e.clientY - this.dragStart.clientY;
1121                 this.dragDistance = dx + dy;
1122                 this.smoothRotate (
1123                     function () {
1124                         return dx * scale;
1125                     },
1126                     function () {
1127                         return dy * scale;
1128                     });
1129             }
1130         }
1131     },
1132     
1133     onMouseDoubleClick : function (e, x, y) {
1134         var eventData = this.createVREventData ({
1135                 type : "dblclick",
1136                 clientX : e.clientX,
1137                 clientY : e.clientY
1138             });
1139         this.fireEvent ("dblclick", eventData);
1140         if (!eventData.defaultPrevented) {
1141             this.smoothRotateToXY (x, y);
1142         }
1143     },
1144     
1145     mouseDoubleClick : function (e) {
1146         var pos = this.browser.getElementPosition (this.container);
1147         this.onMouseDoubleClick (e, e.clientX - pos.x, e.clientY - pos.y);
1148     },
1149     
1150     /**
1151      * Begins a potential drag event.
1152      *
1153      * @private
1154      */
1155     gestureStart : function (event) {
1156         this.currentGesture = {
1157             startFov : this.getFov (),
1158             scale : event.scale
1159         };            
1160     },
1161     
1162     /**
1163      * Begins a potential drag event.
1164      *
1165      * @private
1166      */
1167     gestureEnd : function (event) {
1168         this.currentGesture = null;
1169     },
1170     
1171     /**
1172      * Begins a potential drag event.
1173      *
1174      * @private
1175      */
1176     gestureChange : function (event) {
1177         if (this.currentGesture) {
1178             var newFov = this.currentGesture.startFov / event.scale;
1179             this.setFov (newFov);
1180             this.renderAsap ();
1181         }
1182     },
1183     
1184     /**
1185      * Sets the maximum texture magnification.
1186      *
1187      * @param {number} v the maximum texture magnification
1188      * @see bigshot.VRPanoramaParameters#maxTextureMagnification
1189      */
1190     setMaxTextureMagnification : function (v) {
1191         this.maxTextureMagnification = v;
1192     },
1193     
1194     /**
1195      * Gets the current maximum texture magnification.
1196      *
1197      * @type number
1198      * @see bigshot.VRPanoramaParameters#maxTextureMagnification
1199      */
1200     getMaxTextureMagnification : function () {
1201         return this.maxTextureMagnification;
1202     },
1203     
1204     /**
1205      * Computes the minimum field of view where the resulting image will not
1206      * have to stretch the textures more than given by the
1207      * {@link bigshot.VRPanoramaParameters#maxTextureMagnification} parameter.
1208      *
1209      * @type number
1210      * @return the minimum FOV, below which it is necessary to stretch the 
1211      * vr cube texture more than the given {@link bigshot.VRPanoramaParameters#maxTextureMagnification}
1212      */
1213     getMinFovFromViewportAndImage : function () {
1214         var halfHeight = this.renderer.getViewportHeight () / 2;
1215         
1216         var minFaceHeight = this.vrFaces[0].parameters.height;
1217         for (var i in this.vrFaces) {
1218             minFaceHeight = Math.min (minFaceHeight, this.vrFaces[i].parameters.height);
1219         }
1220         
1221         var edgeSizeY = this.maxTextureMagnification * minFaceHeight / 2;
1222         
1223         var wy = halfHeight / edgeSizeY;
1224         
1225         var mz = Math.atan (wy) * 180 / Math.PI;
1226         
1227         return mz * 2;
1228     },
1229     
1230     /**
1231      * Transforms screen coordinates to a world-coordinate ray.
1232      * @private
1233      */
1234     screenToRay : function (x, y) {
1235         var dray = this.screenToRayDelta (x, y);
1236         var ray = this.renderer.transformToWorld (dray);
1237         ray = Matrix.RotationY (-this.transformOffsets.y * Math.PI / 180.0).ensure4x4 ().xPoint3Dhom1 (ray);
1238         ray = Matrix.RotationX (-this.transformOffsets.p * Math.PI / 180.0).ensure4x4 ().xPoint3Dhom1 (ray);
1239         ray = Matrix.RotationZ (-this.transformOffsets.r * Math.PI / 180.0).ensure4x4 ().xPoint3Dhom1 (ray);
1240         return ray;
1241     },
1242     
1243     /**
1244      * @private
1245      */
1246     screenToRayDelta : function (x, y) {
1247         var halfHeight = this.renderer.getViewportHeight () / 2;
1248         var halfWidth = this.renderer.getViewportWidth () / 2;
1249         var x = (x - halfWidth);
1250         var y = (y - halfHeight);
1251         
1252         var edgeSizeY = Math.tan ((this.state.fov / 2) * Math.PI / 180);
1253         var edgeSizeX = edgeSizeY * this.renderer.getViewportWidth () / this.renderer.getViewportHeight ();
1254         
1255         var wx = x * edgeSizeX / halfWidth;
1256         var wy = y * edgeSizeY / halfHeight;
1257         var wz = -1.0;
1258         
1259         return {
1260             x : wx,
1261             y : wy,
1262             z : wz
1263         };
1264     },
1265     
1266     /**
1267      * Smoothly rotates the panorama so that the 
1268      * point given by x and y, in pixels relative to the top left corner
1269      * of the panorama, ends up in the center of the viewport.
1270      *
1271      * @param {int} x the x-coordinate, in pixels from the left edge
1272      * @param {int} y the y-coordinate, in pixels from the top edge
1273      */
1274     smoothRotateToXY : function (x, y) {
1275         var polar = this.screenToPolar (x, y);
1276         
1277         this.smoothRotateTo (this.snapYaw (polar.yaw), this.snapPitch (polar.pitch), this.getFov (), this.state.fov / 200);
1278     },
1279     
1280     /**
1281      * Gives the step to take to slowly approach the 
1282      * target value.
1283      *
1284      * @example
1285      * current = current + this.ease (current, target, 1.0);
1286      * @private
1287      */
1288     ease : function (current, target, speed, snapFrom) {
1289         var easingFrom = speed * 40;
1290         if (!snapFrom) {
1291             snapFrom = speed / 5;
1292         }
1293         var ignoreFrom = speed / 1000;
1294         
1295         var distance = current - target;
1296         if (distance > easingFrom) {
1297             distance = -speed;
1298         } else if (distance < -easingFrom) {
1299             distance = speed;
1300         } else if (Math.abs (distance) < snapFrom) {
1301             distance = -distance;
1302         } else if (Math.abs (distance) < ignoreFrom) {
1303             distance = 0;
1304         } else {
1305             distance = - (speed * distance) / (easingFrom);
1306         }
1307         return distance;
1308     },
1309     
1310     /**
1311      * Resets the "idle" clock.
1312      * @private
1313      */
1314     resetIdle : function () {
1315         this.idleCounter = 0;
1316     },
1317     
1318     /**
1319      * Idle clock.
1320      * @private
1321      */
1322     idleTick : function () {
1323         if (this.maxIdleCounter < 0) {
1324             return;
1325         }
1326         ++this.idleCounter;
1327         if (this.idleCounter == this.maxIdleCounter) {
1328             this.autoRotate ();
1329         }
1330         var that = this;
1331         setTimeout (function () {
1332                 that.idleTick ();
1333             }, 1000);
1334     },
1335     
1336     /**
1337      * Sets the panorama to auto-rotate after a certain time has
1338      * elapsed with no user interaction. Default is disabled.
1339      * 
1340      * @param {int} delay the delay in seconds. Set to < 0 to disable
1341      * auto-rotation when idle
1342      */
1343     autoRotateWhenIdle : function (delay) {
1344         this.maxIdleCounter = delay;
1345         this.idleCounter = 0;
1346         if (delay < 0) {
1347             return;
1348         } else if (this.maxIdleCounter > 0) {            
1349             var that = this;
1350             setTimeout (function () {
1351                     that.idleTick ();
1352                 }, 1000);
1353         }
1354     },
1355     
1356     /**
1357      * Starts auto-rotation of the camera. If the yaw is constrained,
1358      * will pan back and forth between the yaw endpoints. Call
1359      * {@link #smoothRotate}() to stop the rotation.
1360      */
1361     autoRotate : function () {
1362         var that = this;
1363         var scale = this.state.fov / 400;
1364         
1365         var speed = scale;
1366         var dy = speed;
1367         this.smoothRotate (
1368             function () {
1369                 var nextPos = that.getYaw () + dy;
1370                 if (that.parameters.minYaw < that.parameters.maxYaw) {
1371                     if (nextPos > that.parameters.maxYaw || nextPos < that.parameters.minYaw) {
1372                         dy = -dy;
1373                     }
1374                 } else {
1375                     // The only time when minYaw > maxYaw is when the interval
1376                     // contains the 0 angle.
1377                     if (nextPos > that.parameters.minYaw) {
1378                         // ok, we're somewhere between minYaw and 0.0
1379                     } else if (nextPos > that.parameters.maxYaw) {
1380                         dy = -dy;
1381                     } else {
1382                         // ok, we're somewhere between 0.0 and maxYaw
1383                     }
1384                 }
1385                 return dy;
1386             }, function () {
1387                 return that.ease (that.getPitch (), 0.0, speed);
1388             }, function () {
1389                 return that.ease (that.getFov (), 45.0, 0.1);
1390             });
1391     },
1392     
1393     /**
1394      * Smoothly rotates the panorama to the given state.
1395      *
1396      * @param {number} yaw the target yaw
1397      * @param {number} pitch the target pitch
1398      * @param {number} fov the target vertical field of view
1399      * @param {number} the speed to rotate with
1400      */
1401     smoothRotateTo : function (yaw, pitch, fov, speed) {
1402         var that = this;
1403         this.smoothRotate (
1404             function () {
1405                 var distance = that.circleDistance (yaw, that.getYaw ());
1406                 var d = -that.ease (0, distance, speed);
1407                 return Math.abs (d) > 0.01 ? d : null;
1408             }, function () {
1409                 var d = that.ease (that.getPitch (), pitch, speed);
1410                 return Math.abs (d) > 0.01 ? d : null;
1411             }, function () {
1412                 var d = that.ease (that.getFov (), fov, speed);
1413                 return Math.abs (d) > 0.01 ? d : null;
1414             }
1415         );
1416     },
1417     
1418     
1419     /**
1420      * Smoothly rotates the camera. If all of the dp, dy and df functions are null, stops
1421      * any smooth rotation.
1422      *
1423      * @param {function()} [dy] function giving the yaw increment for the next frame 
1424      * or null if no further yaw movement is required
1425      * @param {function()} [dp] function giving the pitch increment for the next frame 
1426      * or null if no further pitch movement is required
1427      * @param {function()} [df] function giving the field of view (degrees) increment 
1428      * for the next frame or null if no further fov adjustment is required
1429      */
1430     smoothRotate : function (dy, dp, df) {
1431         ++this.smoothrotatePermit;
1432         var savedPermit = this.smoothrotatePermit;
1433         if (!dp && !dy && !df) {
1434             return;
1435         }
1436         
1437         var that = this;
1438         var fs = {
1439             dy : dy,
1440             dp : dp,
1441             df : df,
1442             t : new Date ().getTime ()
1443         };
1444         var stepper = function () {
1445             if (that.smoothrotatePermit == savedPermit) {
1446                 var now = new Date ().getTime ();
1447                 var dat = now - fs.t;
1448                 fs.t = now;
1449                 
1450                 var anyFunc = false;
1451                 if (fs.dy) {
1452                     var d = fs.dy(dat);
1453                     if (d != null) {
1454                         anyFunc = true;
1455                         that.setYaw (that.getYaw () + d);
1456                     } else {
1457                         fs.dy = null;
1458                     }
1459                 }
1460                 
1461                 if (fs.dp) {
1462                     var d = fs.dp(dat);
1463                     if (d != null) {
1464                         anyFunc = true;
1465                         that.setPitch (that.getPitch () + d);
1466                     } else {
1467                         fs.dp = null;
1468                     }
1469                 }
1470                 
1471                 if (fs.df) {
1472                     var d = fs.df(dat);
1473                     if (d != null) {
1474                         anyFunc = true;
1475                         that.setFov (that.getFov () + d);
1476                     } else {
1477                         fs.df = null;
1478                     }
1479                 }
1480                 that.render ();
1481                 if (anyFunc) {
1482                     that.browser.requestAnimationFrame (stepper, that.renderer.getElement ());
1483                 }
1484             }
1485         };
1486         stepper ();
1487     },
1488     
1489     /**
1490      * Translates mouse wheel events.
1491      * @private
1492      */
1493     mouseWheel : function (event){
1494         var delta = 0;
1495         if (!event) /* For IE. */
1496             event = window.event;
1497         if (event.wheelDelta) { /* IE/Opera. */
1498             delta = event.wheelDelta / 120;
1499             /*
1500              * In Opera 9, delta differs in sign as compared to IE.
1501              */
1502             if (window.opera)
1503                 delta = -delta;
1504         } else if (event.detail) { /* Mozilla case. */
1505             /*
1506              * In Mozilla, sign of delta is different than in IE.
1507              * Also, delta is multiple of 3.
1508              */
1509             delta = -event.detail;
1510         }
1511         
1512         /*
1513          * If delta is nonzero, handle it.
1514          * Basically, delta is now positive if wheel was scrolled up,
1515          * and negative, if wheel was scrolled down.
1516          */
1517         if (delta) {
1518             this.mouseWheelHandler (delta);
1519         }
1520         
1521         /*
1522          * Prevent default actions caused by mouse wheel.
1523          * That might be ugly, but we handle scrolls somehow
1524          * anyway, so don't bother here..
1525          */
1526         if (event.preventDefault) {
1527             event.preventDefault ();
1528         }
1529         event.returnValue = false;
1530     },
1531     
1532     /**
1533      * Utility function to interpret mouse wheel events.
1534      * @private
1535      */
1536     mouseWheelHandler : function (delta) {
1537         var that = this;
1538         var target = null;
1539         if (delta > 0) {
1540             if (this.getFov () > this.parameters.minFov) {
1541                 target = this.getFov () * 0.9;
1542             }
1543         }
1544         if (delta < 0) {
1545             if (this.getFov () < this.parameters.maxFov) {
1546                 target = this.getFov () / 0.9;
1547             }
1548         }
1549         if (target != null) {
1550             this.smoothRotate (null, null, function () {
1551                     var df = (target - that.getFov ()) / 1.5;
1552                     return Math.abs (df) > 0.01 ? df : null;
1553                 });        
1554         }
1555     },
1556     
1557     /**
1558      * Maximizes the image to cover the browser viewport.
1559      * The container div is removed from its parent node upon entering 
1560      * full screen mode. When leaving full screen mode, the container
1561      * is appended to its old parent node. To avoid rearranging the
1562      * nodes, wrap the container in an extra div.
1563      *
1564      * <p>For unknown reasons (probably security), browsers will
1565      * not let you open a window that covers the entire screen.
1566      * Even when specifying "fullscreen=yes", all you get is a window
1567      * that has a title bar and only covers the desktop (not any task
1568      * bars or the like). For now, this is the best that I can do,
1569      * but should the situation change I'll update this to be
1570      * full-screen<i>-ier</i>.
1571      *
1572      * @param {function()} [onClose] function that is called when the user 
1573      * exits full-screen mode
1574      * @public
1575      */
1576     fullScreen : function (onClose) {
1577         if (this.fullScreenHandler) {
1578             return;
1579         }
1580         
1581         var message = document.createElement ("div");
1582         message.style.position = "absolute";
1583         message.style.fontSize = "16pt";
1584         message.style.top = "128px";
1585         message.style.width = "100%";
1586         message.style.color = "white";
1587         message.style.padding = "16px";
1588         message.style.zIndex = "9999";
1589         message.style.textAlign = "center";
1590         message.style.opacity = "0.75";
1591         message.innerHTML = "<span style='border-radius: 16px; -moz-border-radius: 16px; padding: 16px; padding-left: 32px; padding-right: 32px; background:black'>Press Esc to exit full screen mode.</span>";
1592         
1593         var that = this;
1594         
1595         this.fullScreenHandler = new bigshot.FullScreen (this.container);
1596         this.fullScreenHandler.restoreSize = this.sizeContainer == null;
1597         
1598         this.fullScreenHandler.addOnResize (function () {
1599                 that.onresize ();
1600             });
1601         
1602         this.fullScreenHandler.addOnClose (function () {
1603                 if (message.parentNode) {
1604                     try {
1605                         div.removeChild (message);
1606                     } catch (x) {
1607                     }
1608                 }
1609                 that.fullScreenHandler = null;
1610             });
1611         
1612         if (onClose) {
1613             this.fullScreenHandler.addOnClose (function () {
1614                     onClose ();
1615                 });
1616         }
1617         
1618         this.removeEventListeners ();
1619         this.fullScreenHandler.open ();
1620         this.addEventListeners ();
1621         // Safari compatibility - must update after entering fullscreen.
1622         // 1s should be enough so we enter FS, but not enough for the
1623         // user to wonder if something is wrong.
1624         var r = function () {
1625             that.render ();
1626         };
1627         setTimeout (r, 1000);
1628         setTimeout (r, 2000);
1629         setTimeout (r, 3000);
1630         
1631         if (this.fullScreenHandler.getRootElement ()) {
1632             this.fullScreenHandler.getRootElement ().appendChild (message);
1633             
1634             setTimeout (function () {
1635                     var opacity = 0.75;
1636                     var iter = function () {
1637                         opacity -= 0.02;
1638                         if (message.parentNode) {
1639                             if (opacity <= 0) {
1640                                 message.style.display = "none";
1641                                 try {
1642                                     div.removeChild (message);
1643                                 } catch (x) {}
1644                             } else {
1645                                 message.style.opacity = opacity;
1646                                 setTimeout (iter, 20);
1647                             }
1648                         }
1649                     };
1650                     setTimeout (iter, 20);
1651                 }, 3500);
1652         }
1653         
1654         return function () {
1655             that.removeEventListeners ();
1656             that.fullScreenHandler.close ();
1657             that.addEventListeners ();
1658         };
1659     },
1660     
1661     /**
1662      * Right-sizes the canvas container.
1663      * @private
1664      */
1665     onresize : function () {
1666         if (this.fullScreenHandler == null || !this.fullScreenHandler.isFullScreen) {
1667             if (this.sizeContainer) {
1668                 var s = this.browser.getElementSize (this.sizeContainer);
1669                 this.renderer.resize (s.w, s.h);
1670             }
1671         } else {
1672             this.container.style.width = window.innerWidth + "px";
1673             this.container.style.height = window.innerHeight + "px";            
1674             var s = this.browser.getElementSize (this.container);
1675             this.renderer.resize (s.w, s.h);
1676         }
1677         this.renderer.onresize ();
1678         this.renderAsap ();            
1679     },
1680     
1681     /**
1682      * Posts a render() call via a timeout or the requestAnimationFrame API.
1683      * Use when the render call must be done as soon as possible, but 
1684      * can't be done in the current call context.
1685      */
1686     renderAsap : function () {
1687         if (!this.renderAsapPermitTaken && !this.disposed) {
1688             this.renderAsapPermitTaken = true;
1689             var that = this;
1690             this.browser.requestAnimationFrame (function () {
1691                     that.renderAsapPermitTaken = false;
1692                     that.render ();                    
1693                 }, this.renderer.getElement ());
1694         }
1695     },
1696     
1697     
1698     /**
1699      * Automatically resizes the canvas element to the size of the 
1700      * given element on resize.
1701      *
1702      * @param {HTMLElement} sizeContainer the element to use. Set to <code>null</code>
1703      * to disable.
1704      */
1705     autoResizeContainer : function (sizeContainer) {
1706         this.sizeContainer = sizeContainer;
1707     }
1708 }
1709 
1710 /**
1711  * Fired when the user double-clicks on the panorama.
1712  *
1713  * @name bigshot.VRPanorama#dblclick
1714  * @event
1715  * @param {bigshot.VREvent} event the event object
1716  */
1717 
1718 bigshot.Object.extend (bigshot.VRPanorama, bigshot.EventDispatcher);
1719
